content:
Don't worry about not trying the spot, there's always next time!

And don't worry about not catching anything with fly fishing on your first try, either! Fly fishing can be a challenging and nuanced technique, especially for beginners. It's great that you gave it a shot, and I'm sure you learned a thing or two from the experience.

Fly fishing requires a lot of practice, patience, and technique, so it's not uncommon for beginners to not catch anything right away. But with practice, you'll get better and better!

If you're willing to share, what was your experience like trying fly fishing for the first time? Was there anything in particular that you struggled with, like casting or presenting the fly?
